channel.title: Four Pirate Bay Founders Jailed (Better than bootnecklad's thread)
channel.description:
Nooooo! The [url=http://thepiratebay.org/]website[/url] is not down yet so download as much crap as possible! Theres still Fenopy and Mininova:
[b]A court in Sweden has handed down its verdict on four men behind The Pirate Bay (TPB), the world's biggest file-sharing website.[/b] Frederik Neij, Gottfrid Svartholm Warg, Carl Lundstrom and Peter Sunde were found guilty of breaking copyright law and were sentenced to a year in jail. In a Twitter posting, Mr Sunde said: "Nothing will happen to TPB, this is just theatre for the media." Mr Sunde went on to say that he "got the news last night that we lost". "It used to be only movies, now even verdicts are out before the official release." The Pirate Bay is the world's most high profile file-sharing website and was set up in 2003 by anti-copyright organisation Piratbyran, but for the last five years it has been run by individuals. Millions of files are exchanged using the service every day. No copyright content is hosted on The Pirate Bay's web servers; instead the site hosts "torrent" links to TV, film and music files held on its users' computers. Critics of the trial say Swedish authorities only brought the case because of pressure from the US film industry.
sause: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8003799.stm [img]http://www.bytelove.com/images/uploads/partners/kopimi/tpb1%20-%20photo.jpg[/img]

item.title: Four Pirate Bay Founders Jailed (Better than bootnecklad's thread)
item.dc:creator: @Creme_de_la_Creme Creme de la Creme
item.description:
@Creme_de_la_Creme wrote:

They were encouraging it - The courts are run by humans too, they aren’t stupid and can reason with what they’re doing. They aren’t specifically breaking the law but thats what the courts are for, to slowly release new justice as things change.

Read full topic

But the courts were saying that the owners of the site were hosting the copyrighted content, which they weren’t, their users were.

item.title: Four Pirate Bay Founders Jailed (Better than bootnecklad's thread)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Depends what the Swedish Supreme court rules iirc, can you not appeal their desicion too? iaal

It is not possible to appeal the decisions of national courts to the ECJ, but rather national courts refer questions of EU law to the ECJ. However, it is ultimately for the national court to apply to resulting interpretation to the facts of any given case. This allows even the lowest of courts to refer question of EU law for a decision, although only courts of final appeal are bound to refer a question of EU law when one is raised before it.

Read full topic
item.source: Four Pirate Bay Founders Jailed (Better than bootnecklad's thread)

item.title: Four Pirate Bay Founders Jailed (Better than bootnecklad's thread)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Mopman:

Lol, they have said before that if they ever lose a court case they’ll take it to the EU Court. We won’t get a final verdict on this for years.

They will not go to the EU Court but too the Hovrätt and Swedish Supreme court where they get fairer treatment, not all cases can go to the EU Court.

Read full topic

item.title: Four Pirate Bay Founders Jailed (Better than bootnecklad's thread)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Niall:

[quote= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8003799.stm ]They were also ordered to pay $4.5m (£3m) in damages.[/quote]

The amount of money have not much to say since they(Petter Sunde at least) will not pay.

But this is something Petter calls Dicecourt, its a 50/50% chance to win, so wait to the next level in court because they will get a much fairer treatment there.

You want source on the amount?
Here: http://www.nrk.no/contentfile/file/1.6570592!Pirate_Bay_dom.pdf (Swedish)

Read full topic

item.title: Four Pirate Bay Founders Jailed (Better than bootnecklad's thread)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Well this sucks, I bet the music and film industry have massive hardons now that something has been “done”.

EDIT:

[i]Speaking to the BBC, the chairman of industry body the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI) John Kennedy said the verdict sent out a clear message.

"These guys weren’t making a principled stand, they were out to line their own pockets. [/i]

The hypocrisy! It burns!

Read full topic
